abstract: Op-Ed article by professor Roger Thompson looks back on life and career of late Maurice White, founder of and singer for band Earth, Wind & Fire; suggests awarding of Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award to White and his band offers fitting occasion to recognize way he skillfully bridged divide between white and black audiences during early 1970s.
snippet: Maurice White should be remembered as the crossover artist who defied the music industry’s focus on white audiences only.
lead_paragraph: Maurice White should be remembered as the crossover artist who defied the music industry’s focus on white audiences only.
